declarations.comments:
An object representing a translation:

- The translation amounts in the `x` and `y` directions, `translateX` and `translateY`.
declarations.title: TranslateTransform

declarations.comments:
Text metrics:

- The text width in pixels.
declarations.title: TextMetrics

declarations.comments: Enumerates types of text alignment.
declarations.title: TextAlign

declarations.comments:
An object representing a scaling transform:

- The scale factors in the `x` and `y` directions, `scaleX` and `scaleY`.
declarations.title: ScaleTransform

declarations.comments:
A type representing a radial gradient.
 -  Starting circle center coordinates: (`x0`, `y0`)
 -  Starting circle radius: `r0`
 -  Ending circle center coordinates: (`x1`, `y1`)
 -  Ending circle radius: `r1`
declarations.title: RadialGradient

declarations.comments:
A type representing a quadratic Bézier curve.
 - Bézier control point: (`cpx`, `cpy`)
 - Ending point coordinates: (`x`, `y`)
declarations.title: QuadraticCurve

declarations.comments: Enumerates the different types of pattern repetitions.
declarations.title: PatternRepeat

declarations.comments:
A type representing a linear gradient.
 -  Starting point coordinates: (`x0`, `y0`)
 -  Ending point coordinates: (`x1`, `y1`)
declarations.title: LinearGradient

declarations.comments: Enumerates the different types of line join
declarations.title: LineJoin

declarations.comments: Enumerates the different types of line cap.
declarations.title: LineCap

declarations.comments: An image data object, used to store raster data outside the canvas.
declarations.title: ImageData

declarations.comments: Canvas dimensions (width and height) in pixels.
declarations.title: Dimensions

declarations.comments: A 2D graphics context.
declarations.title: Context2D

declarations.comments: Enumerates the different types of composite operations and blend modes.
declarations.title: Composite

declarations.comments: Opaque object describing a pattern.
declarations.title: CanvasPattern

declarations.comments: Opaque object for drawing elements and things to the canvas.
declarations.title: CanvasImageSource

declarations.comments: Opaque object describing a gradient.
declarations.title: CanvasGradient

declarations.comments: A canvas HTML element.
declarations.title: CanvasElement

declarations.comments:
A type representing a cubic Bézier curve.
 - First Bézier control point: (`cp1x`, `cp1y`)
 - Second Bézier control point: (`cp2x`, `cp2y`)
 - Ending point: (`x`, `y`)
declarations.title: BezierCurve

declarations.comments:
A type representing an arc object:

- The center coordinates `x` and `y`,
- The radius `r`,
- The starting and ending angles, `start` and `end`.
declarations.title: Arc

declarations.comments: Get the width of an `ImageData` object.
declarations.title: imageDataWidth

declarations.comments: Get the height of an `ImageData` object.
declarations.title: imageDataHeight

declarations.comments: Get the underlying buffer from an `ImageData` object.
declarations.title: imageDataBuffer

declarations.comments:
The `MonadCanvasAction` class captures those monads which support canvas
actions.

Instances are provided for `CanvasActionM` itself, and the standard monad
transformers.

`liftCanvasAction` can be used in any appropriate monad transformer stack
to lift an action of type `CanvasActionM a` into the monad.
declarations.title: MonadCanvasAction

declarations.comments:
The `CanvasActionM` monad is a monad transformer stack, more specifically
the `ReaderT` monad transformer applied to the `Effect` monad, reading a
value of type `Context2D`.
declarations.title: CanvasActionM

declarations.comments: Type synonym for a `CanvasActionM` without a result
declarations.title: CanvasAction

declarations.comments: Run a `CanvasActionM` in a `MonadEffect`, on the provided `Context2D`.
declarations.title: runAction

modules.name: Graphics.CanvasAction
modules.comments:
This module defines all functions from `Graphics.Canvas` (and some extra)
as functions without the `Context2D` parameter, and in the `CanvasActionM`
monad instead of the `Effect` monad. This is to make canvas actions easily
composable without having to worry about passing the `Context2D` to every
single function. They can be composed using `do` notation / bind or
applicative composition (`<*>`, `<*`, and `*>`). Semigroup composition
(`<>`) also works if the return types are the same and also a `Semigroup`
(this includes `Unit`). It also has a `MonadRec` instance. Functions from
this module can be used with any `MonadCanvasActionM`, which is a type
class with instances for monads which support canvas actions. Instances are
provided for `CanvasActionM`, `Run`, and the standard monad transformers.

declarations.comments: Type synonym for skew transformations.
declarations.title: SkewTransform

declarations.comments: Type synonym for matrix transformations.
declarations.title: MatrixTransform

declarations.comments: Enumerates types of text baseline
declarations.title: TextBaseline

declarations.comments:
A value that can be passed to `setFillStyle` and similar functions.
Runtime representation should be either a `String`, a `CanvasGradient` or
a `CanvasPattern`.
declarations.title: CanvasStyle

declarations.comments:
Class describing types that can be turned into a valid `CanvasStyle` for
use with `setFillStyle` and similar functions. This way, there is no
need for functions like `setPatternFillStyle`, **and** values of types like
`Color` can easily used as a fillStyle without problem.
declarations.title: CanvasStyleRep

declarations.comments:
Class describing types that can be turned into a string representing a
canvas color.
declarations.title: CanvasColorRep

declarations.comments: Create a `CanvasElement` of the given size in any `MonadCanvasAction`
declarations.title: createCanvas

declarations.comments:
Same as `createCanvas`, but allows for specifying the `Document` object to
create the canvas with
declarations.title: createCanvas'

declarations.comments: Create a `CanvasElement` of the given size in the `Effect` monad
declarations.title: createCanvasEffect

declarations.comments:
Same as `createCanvasEffect`, but allows for specifying the `Document`
object to create the canvas with
declarations.title: createCanvasEffect'

declarations.comments:
Run a `CanvasActionM` in a `MonadEffect`, on a created canvas with the
provided size. This can be useful for creating patterns for use as a
fillStyle or strokeStyle.

For example:

```purescript
action ∷ CanvasAction
action = do
  pattern ← runActionOffscreen (20.0 >< 20.0) do
    filled "#aaf" fillRectFull
    filled "#afa" $ fillRect (makeRect 0.0 10.0 10.0 10.0)
    filled "#faa" $ fillRect (makeRect 10.0 0.0 10.0 10.0)
    imageSource >>= (_ `createPattern` Repeat)
  fillPathWith pattern do
    circle (200.0 >< 200.0) 175.0
    circle ( 50.0 ><  50.0)  50.0
    circle ( 50.0 >< 350.0)  50.0
    circle (350.0 ><  50.0)  50.0
    circle (350.0 >< 350.0)  50.0
```
declarations.title: runActionOffscreen

declarations.comments:
Run a `CanvasActionM` in a `MonadCanvasAction`, on a created canvas with
the same size as the "main" canvas. This can be useful for creating
patterns for use as a fillStyle or strokeStyle. See `runActionOffscreen`
for an example.
declarations.title: runActionOffscreen'

declarations.comments:
Runs a `CanvasActionM` in a `MonadEffect` inside a functor context. Useful
for turning a function that returns a `CanvasActionM` into a function that
returns an `Effect`.
declarations.title: asEffect

declarations.comments:
Convenience function for constructing `MonadCanvasAction`s from
`Graphics.Canvas`-style functions with no arguments apart from the
`Context2D`.
declarations.title: withCtx

declarations.comments:
Convenience function for constructing `MonadCanvasAction`s from
`Graphics.Canvas`-style functions with one argument apart from the
`Context2D`.
declarations.title: withCtx1

declarations.comments:
Convenience function for constructing `MonadCanvasAction`s from
`Graphics.Canvas`-style functions with two arguments apart from the
`Context2D`.
declarations.title: withCtx2

declarations.comments:
Convenience function for constructing `MonadCanvasAction`s from
`Graphics.Canvas`-style functions with three arguments apart from the
`Context2D`.
declarations.title: withCtx3

declarations.comments:
Convenience function for constructing `MonadCanvasAction`s from
`Graphics.Canvas`-style functions with four arguments apart from the
`Context2D`.
declarations.title: withCtx4

declarations.comments:
Convenience function for constructing `MonadCanvasAction`s from
`Graphics.Canvas`-style functions with five arguments apart from the
`Context2D`.
declarations.title: withCtx5

declarations.comments:
Convenience function for constructing `MonadCanvasAction`s from
`Graphics.Canvas`-style functions with six arguments apart from the
`Context2D`.
declarations.title: withCtx6

declarations.comments:
Convenience function for constructing `MonadCanvasAction`s from
`Graphics.Canvas`-style functions with seven arguments apart from the
`Context2D`.
declarations.title: withCtx7

declarations.comments:
Convenience function for constructing `MonadCanvasAction`s from
`Graphics.Canvas`-style functions with eight arguments apart from the
`Context2D`.
declarations.title: withCtx8

declarations.comments:
Convenience function for constructing `MonadCanvasAction`s from
`Graphics.Canvas`-style functions with nine arguments apart from the
`Context2D`.
declarations.title: withCtx9

declarations.comments:
From a function taking some region and returning a `CanvasActionM`, make
a `CanvasActionM` that calls the original function with the whole canvas
as the region. This can for example be used to draw an image scaled to fill
the entire canvas: `withFull \r → drawImageScale r image`
declarations.title: withFull

declarations.comments:
From a function taking some position and returning a `CanvasActionM`, make
a `CanvasActionM` that calls the original function with the center of the
canvas as a position.
declarations.title: withMidPos

declarations.comments: Get the canvas of a `Context2D`
declarations.title: getCanvasEffect

declarations.comments: Get the canvas as a `CanvasActionM`
declarations.title: getCanvas

declarations.comments:
Convenience function for constructing `CanvasActionM`s from
`Graphics.Canvas`-style functions with no arguments apart from the
`CanvasElement`.
declarations.title: withCanvas

declarations.comments:
Convenience function for constructing `MonadCanvasAction`s from
`Graphics.Canvas`-style functions with one argument apart from the
`CanvasElement`.
declarations.title: withCanvas1

declarations.comments:
Convenience function for constructing `MonadCanvasAction`s from
`Graphics.Canvas`-style functions with two arguments apart from the
`CanvasElement`.
declarations.title: withCanvas2

declarations.comments:
Convenience function for constructing `MonadCanvasAction`s from
`Graphics.Canvas`-style functions with three arguments apart from the
`CanvasElement`.
declarations.title: withCanvas3

declarations.comments: Fill a rectangular area
declarations.title: fillRect

declarations.comments: Fill a rectangular area that covers the entire canvas

declarations.comments: Stroke a rectangular area that covers the entire canvas
declarations.title: strokeRectFull

declarations.comments: Clear a rectangular area
declarations.title: clearRect

declarations.comments: Clear a rectangular area that covers the entire canvas
declarations.title: clearRectFull

declarations.comments:
Run a `CanvasActionM` with the given fillStyle, resetting it to the
previous value after
declarations.title: filled

declarations.comments:
Run a `CanvasActionM` with the given strokeStyle, resetting it to the
previous value after
declarations.title: stroked

declarations.comments: Set x and y shadow offset at the same time
declarations.title: setShadowOffset

declarations.comments: Create a data URL for the current canvas contents
declarations.title: toDataUrl

declarations.comments:
Render image data on the canvas. The first argument (`p`) is the point on
the canvas to place the topleft of the data. The second argument (`r`) is
the region of the `ImageData` to render.
declarations.title: putImageDataFull

declarations.comments:
Render image data on the canvas. The first argument (`p`) is the point on
the canvas to place the topleft of the data.
declarations.title: putImageData

declarations.comments: Draw an image, scaled to fit the provided region
declarations.title: drawImageScale

declarations.comments:
Draw an image on the canvas. The first arugment is the region of the image
to draw, and the second argument is the region to draw it in.
declarations.title: drawImageFull

declarations.comments:
Asynchronously load an image file by specifying its path and a callback
`CanvasAction`.
declarations.title: tryLoadImage

declarations.comments:
Asynchronously load an image file by specifying its path and a callback
`Effect Unit`.
declarations.title: tryLoadImage'

declarations.comments:
Asynchrounously load an image file by specifying its path. The returned
`Aff` will throw an error if the image wasn't found.
declarations.title: loadImageAff

declarations.comments: Set the context's `imageSmoothingEnabled` property
declarations.title: setImageSmoothing

declarations.comments:
Create a canvas pattern from an image, which can be used as a fill- or
strokeStyle
declarations.title: createPattern

declarations.comments:
Constructs a blank linear `CanvasGradient` that can be modified with
`addColorStop`.
declarations.title: createLinearGradient

declarations.comments:
Constructs a blank radial `CanvasGradient` that can be modified with
`addColorStop`.
declarations.title: createRadialGradient

declarations.comments:
Note: Mutates the original `CanvasGradient` and returns `Unit`.
It is recommended to construct gradients with `linearGradient` and
`radialGradient` instead.
declarations.title: addColorStop

declarations.comments: Saves the context, see [`save` on MDN](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/save)
declarations.title: save

declarations.comments: Restores the context, see [`restore` on MDN](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/restore)
declarations.title: restore

declarations.comments: Runs `save`, then the provided action, then `restore`
declarations.title: restoreAfter

declarations.comments:
The `MonadCanvasAction` class captures those monads which support canvas
actions.

Instances are provided for `CanvasActionM` itself, and the standard monad
transformers.

`liftCanvasAction` can be used in any appropriate monad transformer stack
to lift an action of type `CanvasActionM a` into the monad.
declarations.title: MonadCanvasAction

modules.name: Graphics.CanvasAction.Path
modules.comments:
This module defines a free monad for working with canvas paths in a more
pleasant way. Make your paths by combining `lineTo`, `moveTo`, `arc`,
`rect`, `quadraticCurveTo`, `bezierCurveTo`, and `closePath` using `<>` or
`bind` (`do` notation), and use them with `fillPath`, `fillPathWith`,
`strokePath`, `strokePathWith`, and `clip`.

Example:
```purescript
action ∷ CanvasAction
action = fillPathWith "red" path

path ∷ Path
path = do
  moveTo (100.0 >< 100.0)
  lineTo (200.0 >< 10.0)
  lineTo (10.0 >< 100.0)
  closePath
  polygon
    [ 0.0 >< 0.0
    , 20.0 >< 200.0
    , 100.0 >< 175.0
    , 30.0 >< 150.0
    ]
  circle (100.0 >< 100.0) 50.0
```
`action` is a `CanvasAction` that can be run in `Effect` with `runAction`
from `Graphics.CanvasAction`.

declarations.comments:
Draw a polygon with the specified points. Starts and ends on the first
point.
declarations.title: polygon

declarations.comments:
Draw a circle with the specified center and radius. Ends on the rightmost
point of the circle.
declarations.title: circle

declarations.comments: Type alias for using `CanvasActionM` as an effect
declarations.title: CANVAS

declarations.comments: Symbol proxy for "canvas"
declarations.title: _canvas

declarations.comments: Lift a `CanvasActionM` into `Run` via the `canvas` label
declarations.title: liftCanvasAction

declarations.comments: Lift a `CanvasActionM` into `Run` via the provided label
declarations.title: liftCanvasActionAt

declarations.comments: Runs a base `CanvasActionM` effect
declarations.title: runBaseCanvas

declarations.comments: Runs a base `CanvasActionM` effect at the provided label
declarations.title: runBaseCanvasAt

declarations.comments: Runs base `CanvasActionM` and `Effect` together as one effect
declarations.title: runBaseCanvas'

declarations.comments:
Runs base `CanvasActionM` and `Effect` together as one effect at the
provided labels
declarations.title: runBaseCanvasAt'

modules.name: Graphics.CanvasAction.Transformation
modules.comments:
This module defines a free monad for working with canvas transformations in
a more pleasant way. Construct transforms with the various functions, like
`translate`, `scale` and `matrixTransform`. There are also alternate
functions (denoted by a `'`), which take the dedicated data type for that
transform, instead of `Number`s, as arguments. Perform a transform with
`runTransform`, or use `transformed` to also reset the transformation
matrix to its previous value afterwards.

declarations.comments: Reset the transformation matrix to its default value
declarations.title: resetTransform

declarations.comments:
Construct a `Transformation` from six `Number`s representing a matrix
transformation, replacing the current matrix
declarations.title: setTransform

declarations.comments:
Construct a `Transformation` from a `MatrixTransform`, replacing the
current matrix
declarations.title: setTransform'

declarations.comments: Get the current transformation matrix
declarations.title: getTransform

declarations.comments: Construct a `Transformation` from two `Number`s representing translation
declarations.title: translate

declarations.comments: Construct a `Transformation` from a `TranslateTransform`
declarations.title: translate'

declarations.comments: Construct a `Transformation` from two `Number`s representing scaling
declarations.title: scale

declarations.comments: Construct a `Transformation` from a `ScaleTransform`
declarations.title: scale'

declarations.comments: Construct a `Transformation` from two `Number`s representing skew
declarations.title: skew

declarations.comments: Construct a `Transformation` from a `SkewTransform`
declarations.title: skew'

declarations.comments: Construct a `Transformation` from a `Number` representing radians rotated
declarations.title: rotate

declarations.comments:
Construct a `Transformation` from six `Number`s representing a matrix
transformation, multiplying the new matrix with the current matrix
declarations.title: matrixTransform

declarations.comments:
Construct a `Transformation` from a `MatrixTransform`, multiplying the
new matrix with the current matrix
declarations.title: matrixTransform'

declarations.comments: Run a transformation
declarations.title: runTransform

declarations.comments: Run a transformation on a `MonadCanvasAction`, transforming back afterwards
declarations.title: transformed

declarations.comments:
The `CanvasActionM` monad is a monad transformer stack, more specifically
the `ReaderT` monad transformer applied to the `Effect` monad, reading a
value of type `Context2D`.
declarations.title: CanvasActionM

declarations.comments: Type synonym for a `CanvasActionM` without a result
declarations.title: CanvasAction

declarations.comments: Run a `CanvasActionM` in a `MonadEffect`, on the provided `Context2D`.
declarations.title: runAction
